wikipedia_page.main: Sheila Begbie  is a Scottish footballer and sports administrator who is currently Director of Domestic Rugby at the Scottish Rugby Union (SRU). She played as a central defender for Edinburgh Dynamos and the Scotland women's national team, making 25 international appearances after debuting for Scotland aged 15. She later entered football administration, spending sixteen years as head of Girls' and Women's Football at the Scottish Football Association (SFA) before switching to rugby union with the SRU in 2014.

response: In May 2014, it was announced that Sheila Begbie had been appointed to the newly created post of Head of Women's Rugby, reporting directly to the Director of Rugby and she was due to commence this role in August 2014.
* Sheila Begbie – Director of Domestic Rugby at the Scottish Rugby Union and former footballer
